title: Calculus I
description: Differential calculus of algebraic and transcendental functions, applications to optimization and related rate problems, introduction to integration.

title: Calculus II
description: Continuation of Calculus I. Integration techniques, applications of integration, infinite series, parametric equations, and polar coordinates.

title: Calculus III
description: Multivariable calculus including partial derivatives, multiple integrals, vector fields, line and surface integrals, and Green's and Stokes' theorems.

title: Differential Equations
description: First and higher order differential equations, series solutions, Laplace transforms, and applications to physical and engineering problems.

title: Linear Algebra
description: Vector spaces, linear transformations, matrices, determinants, eigenvalues and eigenvectors, and applications.

title: Discrete Mathematics
description: Logic, set theory, combinatorics, graph theory, and applications to computer science.

title: Abstract Algebra
description: Groups, rings, fields, and their applications. Introduction to algebraic structures and their properties.

title: Real Analysis
description: Rigorous treatment of limits, continuity, differentiation, and integration of functions of one variable.
